data.value:
Welcome to chris-ferrario.com and thank you for visiting.

I have built this website in an effort to showcase my experience and skills.


Who am I?

My name is Christian Ferrario, I am a 25 year old programmer raised in France and in the US since this year.

I am Italian-American and can speak English, French and Italian. I can also communicate in Spanish and know the basics of German and Mandarin. I believe that knowing these languages were a big help for me when switching between programming languages.

I've wanted to be a game programmer since about 5 years ago, i had no programming skills prior to that. I chose to go to a general programming school rather than a game programming school because I really wanted to learn from all different fields and have an all-around view of programming to be able to adapt to any situation. I really enjoy learning new things and have been feeding on game programming books and online tutorials throughout my education to be able to take my school projects a little further and turn them into games.

I now have close to two years of professional experience under my belt as well as six projects that are sold commercially.

What am I doing?

After working a year as a cybercafe manager, I realized how important the gaming industry was becoming. Having always been creative, I decided that playing games wouldn't be enough, I wanted to make them. This is when I quit literary studies and enrolled into a computer school without any programming knowledge, a choice I have never regretted.

I have since then fallen in love with programming on a larger scale, especially when object oriented.
After three years worth of training through school projects in addition to a year working at DeValley Entertainment in Paris, where i learned the wonderful world of bitwise programming and low level optimizing in Java Mobile Games, I joined Gameloft in their New York city office.
Sadly, due to the financial crises and being one of the most recent hirings, I have suffered from the waves of layoffs but I quickly decided to get back into C/C++ and am now working on a Nintendo DS Homebrew project.

What I have done?

I have worked on five commercial projects with DeValley Entertainement during 2007 and 2008. I also worked on one unnamed mobile game for Gameloft.
  • As a main programmer:
    • Nowhere (nominated for best french mobile game of 2007)
    • The Spiderwick Chronicles (published by Vivendi Universal Games Mobile)
  • As a support programmer:
    • Landers (nominated for best french mobile game of 2008)
    • Holy Wars
    • Crash of the Titans (published by Vivendi Universal Games Mobile)
    • Unnamed Gameloft game To be released later.
What I can already do

I have set up this Portfolio to display the skills with which I am hoping to make a career out of. Most of my ready-to-use experience is in Java mobile technology. I have also been involved with programming for the Android operating system and have develloped a fully functioning Tetris clone for it (available here). I also enjoy working in C# and am trying to use it as much as possible like with this site coded in ASP.NET/AJAX and in my spare time when I am self-teaching myself Microsoft's XNA. I have also worked with C++ in an Ogre/Newton based 6 month project in school. But all in all the language doesn't matter that much to me, it's the concepts, routines and Dev Gems that really fascinate me.
I also have listed my skills and aptitudes in my Resume site.



But don't take it from me, listen to Chuck!
